item.title: Delivery of heavy weapons: Is Germany now a party to the war in Ukraine?
item.description: Germany's decision to deliver tanks to Ukraine drew criticism from Russia and speculation about whether this step could make Germany a party to the conflict. In international law, there is a simple answer to that question.
item.keywords: DWVC,Germany, Ukraine, Russia, war, tanks, international law

media:content.media:title: Delivery of heavy weapons: Is Germany now a party to the war in Ukraine?
media:content.media:keywords: DWVC,Germany, Ukraine, Russia, war, tanks, international law

item.title: A safety risk for men?
item.description: In São Paulo, nine out of 10 kidnappings happened during a date arranged on Tinder or other dating apps.
item.keywords: DWVC,Brazil, São Paulo, Tinder, online dating, safety, kidnapping, men

media:content.media:title: A safety risk for men?
media:content.media:keywords: DWVC,Brazil, São Paulo, Tinder, online dating, safety, kidnapping, men

item.title: Woman in Tigray lost husband and son to violence
item.description: This woman in Tigray lost both her husband and son to a massacre. Almost 600,000 lives have been lost in the conflict, before Ethiopian and Tigrayan forces signed a peace deal in November 2022. @DW

media:content.media:title: Woman in Tigray lost husband and son to violence

item.title: Deadly asbestos in Indonesia
item.description: Asbestos is cheap and heat-resistant. It was used widely in building materials all around the world. Today, it is banned in over 70 countries, including all EU member states. But the carcinogenic material is still widely used in developing countries.
item.keywords: DWVC,Indonesia, Asbestos, EU ban, developing countries

media:content.media:title: Deadly asbestos in Indonesia
media:content.media:keywords: DWVC,Indonesia, Asbestos, EU ban, developing countries

item.title: Extensive reconstruction of Bucha in motion
item.description: Bucha, made famous around the world for the atrocities Russian troops carried out there. The main road was strewn with bodies when the Russians leftâ€¯- and the houses were also partially destroyed by artillery. Now work is underway to repair the houses and turn Bucha back into a livable community.
item.keywords: DWVC,Ukraine, Bucha, Russia, war, reconstruction, housing

media:content.media:title: Extensive reconstruction of Bucha in motion
media:content.media:keywords: DWVC,Ukraine, Bucha, Russia, war, reconstruction, housing

item.title: Jehovah's Witness hall shooting in Hamburg
item.description: Police officials said the perpetrator and the victims were all German citizens. The gunman killed himself, and an unborn baby as well as seven others were pronounced dead.

media:content.media:title: Jehovah's Witness hall shooting in Hamburg

item.title: What's behind Moldova's anti-government protests?
item.description: While Moldova's parliament has adopted a declaration condemning Russia's invasion of Ukraine, some people feel nostalgic about the days when the country was part of the Soviet Union. @DW
item.keywords: DWVC,Moldova, Russia, agent, protest, legislation, Chisinau, Transnistria

item.title: Iranian women continue to fight for freedom
item.description: Nearly six months after Jina Masha Amini was killed for not dressing the way the Islamic Republic wanted to, women without hijab are conquering the streets of Iran. Although it is against the law, many women are taking the risk to make a stand. @DW
item.keywords: DWVC,Iran, women, human rights, hijab, Masha Amini, freedom, self-determination
